arm_group.description: For subjects in this group, they will accept intracranially implanted carmustine intraoperatively.
For subjects in this control group, they accept no implants while gliomas maximally be resected.

brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of the study is to determine the safety and efficacy of intracranially implanted
      Carmustine in the treatment of patients with primary malignant glioma.

clinical_study.brief_title: Safety and Efficacy Study of Intracranially Implanted Carmustine to Treat Newly Diagnosed Malignant Glioma

detailed_description.textblock:
Malignant gliomas recur mostly 2 cm within originated area. Local therapies therefore become
      particular important. Gliadel wafer developed in the States and marketed in the developed
      countries is an example of such treatments. The product in this study, Carmustine Sustained
      Release Implant (CASANT), is similar to that of Gliadel wafer as for the API(Active
      Pharmaceutical Ingredient), but different as for drug delivering system. As required, the
      preliminary clinical studies were conducted in China. Based on the results of phase I/II ,
      8-10 wafers containing given dose of BCNU will be administered intracranially in this phase
      III to the tumor resected cavity to investigate the safety and efficacy in the treatment of
      primary malignant glioma in 236 patients.

intervention.description: As Experimental group, subjects will accept specified wafers of carmustine in the cavity while gliomas maximally be resected.
For this group, subjects will accept routine tumor resection surgery and place no implant wafers.

link.description: You will see subjects recruitment information when visiting above website.

facility.name: Beijing Tiantan Hospital Affiliated to Capital Medical University

clinical_study.official_title: Phase 3 Study of Carmustine Sustained Release Implant (CASANT) to Treat Newly Diagnosed Malignant Glioma

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: Occurrence rate of adverse event and serious adverse event revealed by laboratory test outcomes including blood routine and chemistry as well as physical examination, vital signs including blood pressure, temperature, respiratory rate , heart rate.
secondary_outcome.measure: Safety of intracranially implanted carmustine after maximal tumor resection

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment
